intro: Trachyspermum calcicola, commonly known as the limestone coriander, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other members of the Apiaceae family. Trachyspermum calcicola plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat due to its extensive root system.
